item.title: Consultant, Business Analytics and Data Engineering
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Consultant, Business Analytics and Data Engineering reporting to the Director, Cards and Deposits Data, Analytics and Decision Science and will be accountable for the day-to-day and strategic opportunities that align with the PBB Strategy. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will work on the delivery of data driven insights and solutions to evaluate client behaviors and to optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas.   

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Innovative Problem Solving – Actively lead the development, delivery, and continuous improvement of complex data analytics and visualization solutions. Focus on quality, depth of analysis, and clear communication of actionable recommendations.
  • Business Effectiveness - Identify and recommend changes that enhance operations whether through technology or other processes to ensure the efficiency and effectiveness of the department.
  • Strategic Thinking Approach – Drive, manage and execute PBB data and reporting projects and initiatives in alignment with CIBC and PBB Strategy while supporting the business goals, objectives and KPIs. Ability to think strategically about how to mobilize and engage teams across the enterprise to deliver strategic change.
  • Relationship Management - Manage the relationship between the Data and Reporting and various partners throughout the bank with a high focus on client experience and partnering for shared success.  Build internal and external relationships as required to help ensure we are providing the right level of service to our leadership team and business partners. 
  • Communication -  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, processes, and technology solutions to others with different disciplinary backgrounds. Ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate command of language, clarity of thought and orderliness of presentation.
  • Reporting - Track progress and conduct analysis of data and reports. Support in the tracking and communication of performance metrics.

Who You Are  

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. Understanding internal banking processes and how they translate into data outputs.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You use your relationships and technical knowledge to influence enterprise projects.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Databricks, Hive, IBM Cognos Business Intelligence, IBM Netezza, Python, SAS BI, Tableau

item.title: Senior Manager, Secured Lending Analytics (RESL)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing­­

The Senior Manager, Secured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking Real Estate Secured Lending product line. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader and subject matter expert in Real Estate Secured Lending– Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements

  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.

  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.

  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.

  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).

  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.

  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).

  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).

  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).

  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.

  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Actionable Insights, Advanced Analytics, Alteryx, Big Data, Consulting, Dashboard Creation, Dashboards Design, IBM Cognos Business Intelligence, Problem Solving, Python, R Code, SAS Platform, Statistics, Structured Query Language (SQL), Tableau, Taking Initiative

item.title: Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

  • Support the development of proposals/business cases for credit risk scorecards, system or rule changes that will enhance credit risk management performance.
  • Conduct pre and post-analyses of acquisition strategy performance.  Provide objective and sound feedback on the performance of acquisition strategies.  Make specific recommendations to improve future performance.
  • Quantify and grade risk-adjusted profit as well as credit risk performance.
  • Actively monitor the performance of key origination strategies.  Alert senior management to any signs of potential emerging risk or performance degradation.
  • Build deep subject matter knowledge of (i) TTD adjudication system rules, tables and cutoffs and (ii) acquisition campaign criteria.  Assess the merits of adjudication cutoffs and rules logic for TTD and campaign channels.  Ensure that cutoffs align with RACD’s risk appetite.
  • Play a lead role in managing the TTD decision engine simulation environment.
  • Ensure accuracy and integrity of data throughout the analytical process.  Play a lead role in continuously improving the breadth and quality of available data.
  • Invoke champion/challenger methodologies as appropriate.
  • Build and maintain sound working relationships with key business partner groups such as Product Management, Technology, etc.
  • Design and build new tracking and reporting capabilities to evaluate strategy performance.

How You\'ll Succeed

  • The candidate would be required to have extensive knowledge of how to develop dynamic dashboards, charts and graphs that senior leadership can drill down into and use to understand trends.
  • Experience in Excel Pivot tables, calculations, graphs and charts is essential and candidate must be able to customize these as requested by team.
  • Being able to develop dynamic dashboards (in Tableau/PowerBI) that can be used for different types of views into the data.
  • The candidate must be comfortable with advanced SQL queries and must be able to use SQL to draw relevant data, integrate it and clean it in a data hub environment.
  • The Candidate should have an in-depth knowledge of how to work in SAS and should be comfortable understanding existing SAS code and developing their own SAS queries to pull, integrate and output data.
  • Strong experience in Python is essential and the candidate must be able to manipulate and analyze large, complex datasets in addition to being able to build their own datasets from existing data sources.
  • Knowledge of Data science and Analytics concepts is essential as candidate will be expected to support model development efforts in the Risk Modelling sphere.
  • Experience with models like Decision Trees. Random Forest, XG Boost as well as associated concepts such as hyper parameter tuning, model validation and model monitoring.
  • Must be comfortable communicating complex ideas during presentations in a simple and concise manner to facilitate understanding.
  • Should be able to use data and visuals to derive narratives that explain trends and insights.
  • A strong grasp of financial terms used in Risk as well as their interpretation is strongly preferred.
  • Candidate must be able to understand and interpret complex financial data as well as spot any anomalies and inconsistencies in financial data.
  • Comfortable working in Excel and Python to perform complex financial calculations that are dynamically updated with new inputs.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in principles of credit analysis and risk management relating to retail lending portfolios.  Prior experience in retail credit is an asset.
  • You have a strong financial background and can understand financial information in the portfolio as well as spot and explain anomalies.
  • Ability to interpret and analyze information to formulate solutions.  Strong problem solving skills evidenced by a proven track record.
  • Experience with acquisition risk strategy development, including implementation via automated risk management systems such as Decision Manager, Capstone is an asset.
  • Knowledge of advanced Excel functionality including pivot tables and charts, string manipulation, lookups, and filters.
  • Knowledge of at least one dashboarding software (Tableau, PowerBI etc.)
  • Strong experience in Python, SAS and SQL is a pre-requisite.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 29th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Sr. Consultant, Business Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Director, Reporting & MIS, the Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible for developing value added, actionable insights, by leveraging both internal and external data combined with analytical techniques.  Using a combined business, technical, and data focused lens, this individual will transform raw data and numbers into meaningful insights through a combination of data feeds, reports, dashboards, and self-serve analytical tools. The successful candidate will be an energetic and self-motivated individual with strong software skills, a commitment to details, and a keen client focus.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Participate as a thought partner and provide advice and recommendations that assist in the development and evolution of our business mandate and help our business make Better Decisions Faster
  • Consult with business partners to understand the business issues, problem or decision to be made and the detailed requirements.
  • Provide advice and recommendations on available data sources to address the business need.
  • Gain agreement on scope and analytical approach (ie., Timing, Universe, Metrics, Segmentation) deliverable(s) and timeline
  • Consult with technology partners and other data owners to identify relevant data sources and data elements and develop a technical plan (analytical blueprint) to address the business issue
  • Use analytical tools and techniques (e.g. SQL, SAS, Toad) with efficiency and attention to detail, extract, synthesize and interpret large amounts of appropriate information from multiple sources.
  • Utilize BI/visualization tools (e.g. Tableau) and use your storytelling skills to translate data into compelling reports and presentations for key stakeholders including Senior Executives. Identify and communicate trends and opportunities, establish and measure KPIs.
  • Design, develop, and implement fully automated processes from end-to-end that take raw, unstructured datasets and transform them into self-serve analytical “assets” in a structured environment used by analytical and non-analytical end users.
  • Promote reporting automation, self-serve analytics consumption, and the culture of analytics-driven decision making.  Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, and re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability.
  • Develop concise and easy to understand summaries
  • Present insights, advice and recommendations to cross functional business partners at different levels within the organization
  • Communicate with business partners to keep them in the loop on progress, obstacles and timeline

Who You Are

  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business and technical problems and recommend solutions
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to translate complex analyses into simple and effective reporting and dashboards
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization
  • You have a degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Engineering/ Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other analytically based discipline or equivalent work experience. 
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience with data analysis and querying using SAS and/or SQL.
  • Proven skills in designing high-quality dashboards and performance scorecards using visualization tools such as Tableau
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, data management and project management skills; ability to guide the design of and leverage insights from all analyses.
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple activities of varying complexity while under time constraints.
  • Previous financial services experience would be an asset
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

The successful candidate will be an energetic and self-motivated individual with exceptional consultative skills and an intense client focus.

In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. item.title: Senior Manager, Pricing Analytics, Personal Lending
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Director, New Channels and Products, this position will work with key partners in Risk, Product Analytics and other stakeholders as required, establish reliable empirical foundations for pricing and accepting risk within Unsecured Lending, and for optimizing rate, 3rd party incentives and other factors to maximize long-term risk adjusted returns. The Senior manager will collaborate with internal stakeholders as well as external credit bureau agencies to enable the development of industry specific models and score cards to assess customer probability of default and profitability levels for current and new digital unsecured lending channels. You will also be accountable for building and maintaining analytic and reporting foundations around the product.


At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.
 

How You’ll Succeed

1. Contribute to the development of credit models to predict risk and other key outcomes at the Client and Merchant by vertical level

2. Will leverage and apply these models and scorecards to the business; and will collaborate with Risk and Finance partners, as well as other internal stakeholders to drive continuous improvement to these model

3. Execute the development of client pricing strategies and merchant incentive structures that optimize long-term risk-adjusted returns.

4. Maintain ongoing accountability to Risk and other partners for business results

5. Work with Risk, Analytics & Decision Science and credit bureau agencies, along with other stakeholders to build partnerships and learn and apply best practices, and share learnings developed in Personal Lending.

6. Develop key measures and reports necessary to track and manage the effectiveness of existing models.

7. Maintain an awareness of industry trends and products, particularly in the area of bureau scores and bureau data, and other data sources and techniques that could be used to predict risk-adjusted profitability.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in retail lending, 3 plus years’ experience in predictive analytics with elements of credit risk and profit optimization related to retail Unsecured Lending. Proven experience with advanced analytics concepts in context of retail lending. Ability to research and analyze complex data for segmentation and trend analysis

  • You have a University degree with strong knowledge of mathematics/statistics, engineering or other STEM disciplines, applied in a business context.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

Job Description

What you\'ll be doing

You will join CIBC\'s Identity and Access Operations team as an IAM and Infrastructure Reporting Consultant to monitor, analyze, review, and remediate access to CIBC\'s technology. You will support the execution of our team\'s mandate by defining, implementing and reporting on key metrics and other defined measurements related to business deliverables and processes. You will provide technical expertise in development and support of all activities, processes, procedures and tools used for validating and insuring the integrity of information security.

You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How you\'ll succeed

  • Reporting and Metrics – You can identify metrics thresholds and business rules for measuring data quality and ensuring adherence with bank and regulatory standards. You have creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable approach that results in providing CIBC with optimum solutions to business issues/challenges. This includes performing specific data or analysis based on business user requests and contribution to automation of reporting requirements, design documents for data quality & data management. You have experience with scripting, Excel, PowerPoint and Tableau and the ability to analyze raw data to provide predictive and prescriptive analytics.

  • Technical Skills – You have Windows and Linux knowledge relating to Identity and Access, Infrastructure and application knowledge to identify datasets and to provide solutions for process and operational improvements. You must have extensive experience in SQL query, scripting (Python and R), advanced PowerPoint and Excel. Knowledge of Tableau and Visio is an asset. Knowledge of multiple infrastructure platforms such as NAS, UNIX, WINTEL, MSSQL, Oracle, DB2, Sybase, AS400, Active Directory is an asset.

  • Identity Analytics and Administration – You have the ability to identify compliant or appropriate access to infrastructure and data. This includes risk analysis of current and new use cases and continuous update of documentation. You have the ability to handle client escalations and prioritize activities. You will drive the identity management and process effectiveness in security processes and understand and follow Identity and Access Management (IAM) processes.

  • Consulting – You will be responsible for collaborating with projects and initiatives to create and execute access management for new/existing infrastructure, aligning with Identity & Access Management (IAM) initiatives and related policies, standards, and procedures to help enhance our information security posture. You will assist other teams in investigation of potential security incidents and provide recommendations to remediate.

  • Process Improvement – You will recommend solutions to enhance processes, eliminate risks, and improve the speed and quality of key services to our partners. You have the ability to apply appropriate tools to perform problem determination and root cause analysis; identify bottlenecks, redundancies and vulnerabilities of existing processes as they relate to identity and access management.

  • Other Skills –You can link operational activities and risks to controls and standards. You understand risk management framework to incorporate risk assessment to operational and improvement initiatives.  Hands-on experience the of following tools and application is an asset: SailPoint IdentityIQ, ServiceNow, Varonis, ARS/AD

Who you are

item.title: Sr. UX Strategist
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

You’ll work on the Frontline Technology Strategy User Experience (UX) team which is responsible for conceptualizing and designing UX for employee-facing software applications. You’ll partner with other units across the bank to shape and communicate user experience strategies and design, often serving as the team advisor responsible for defining the overall UX vision throughout the digital ecosystem. You’ll apply an user-centred design approach by using various Research methods while integrating Design Thinking, Strategic Foresight and Analytics in order to fulfill the needs of the Business.  You’ll present recommendations to stakeholders and executives based on data, user feedback and insights collected to support with strategic decision making that support a long-term vision.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • UX Strategy – You’ll work with stakeholders and other members of the Frontline UX Team to give valuable input and recommendations to key business decisions with an user-centered mindset. You’ll help define an UX Vision and an UX Roadmap for our direct organization using Strategic Foresight. You’ll leverage core themes and findings from UX Research activities and communicate it to the Business for impactful and meaningful short, medium and long-term strategic decisions, while supporting with prioritizing activities and working closely to the Innovation team.
  • Data Analysis – You’ll give meaning to data by connecting design strategy and business metrics. You will look deeply into human behavioral data e how it shifts among time to propose unique but adoptable solutions and approaches to form a robust UX strategy roadmap.
  • Collaborate - You’ll work closely with a multidisciplinary team to develop experiences for our clients and employees. You’ll build strong relationships with stakeholders to help them set a vision for projects, including framing the problems to be solved and defining criteria for project success. You’ll work effectively within constraints, understanding the broader organizational context but also being ready to challenge it when necessary.
  • Research and Present – You’ll promote UX research studies, develop Personas, facilitate discovery sessions, run design thinking workshops, and analyze qualitative and quantitative data. You’ll analyze and translate research data into meaningful insights and powerful stories using artifacts such as customer journey maps, videos and storyboards, executive memos, compelling reports, and townhall presentations that explain unmet needs and present opportunities for change in the future-facing and nearer-term experiences.
  • Teamwork– Promote both user-centred and client-centred designs to project peers in a collaborative way that supports Business Strategy. Establish and build healthy working relations and partnerships with stakeholders, Tech partners, vendors and peers to drive research-led design process.
  • Leadership -  Articulate business value of UX Strategy to stakeholders.

Who You Are

  • You have a minimum of 5+ years of hands-on UX related experience. Team or project Lead experience is an asset.
  • You have a degree/diploma in design and research such as Behavioural Science, Inclusive Design, Data Science, Industrial Design, Business, Information Studies, Cognitive Psychology, Product Design or related fields.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You are curious and can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

As a Fusion Reporting Consultant, you will provide expert and specialized reporting.  You will play a key role in the build, reconciliation and automation of operational reporting across Fusion teams.  You will develop Key Performance Indicator (KPI) business benefit, and Key Risk Indicator (KRI) reporting to support Fusion Program delivery.  You will also develop risk, governance, operational, and regulatory reporting for the Fusion team as required. You will be a subject matter expert in developing robust methodologies for reporting and dashboarding. Utilize creative thinking and apply mathematical, financial and statistical methods in the design/development of new analysis to support strategic decision making.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role  you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Reporting – Design, develop and deliver visual reporting using state of the art visual reporting tools. Provide complex analytical reporting capability to Fusion business units based on requirements combined with a business assessment of each functional unit’s business needs. Develop an operational measurement & reporting plan for new initiatives and use cases, as well existing business operations processes. Deliver monthly dashboards such as use case benefits, Operational performance Dashboards, Incident management reporting, Intelligence threat reporting, Executive Business and Partner dashboards which provide Fusion with the ability to measure the success of our business and provide insight into areas to focus.

Create processes and code to automate delivery of new and existing standard analytics & reporting in SAS, Tableau and Microsoft Office. Deliver moderately complex data quality extract and manipulation reviews using SAS / SQL and deliver feedback on those reviews.   • Relationship Management - Develop and maintain productive relationships with management, peers and others across all lines of business. Collaborate with Business Controls, Risk, and regulatory teams.

  • You can demonstrate 4+ years of experience in supporting desktop environment and end user technologies; strong technical knowledge and subject matter expertise of Microsoft technologies, including Windows 10, Azure Windows Analytics, Azure Desktop Analytics, Windows Server 2019/2016/2012 R2/2012, SQL Server 2019/2017/2016/2008 and Active Directory, including Group Policies; strong technical knowledge of virtualization technologies, including VMWare, Hyper-V, VDI, SCVMM2012 and SCVMM2016; strong scripting language expertise with PowerShell; strong technical knowledge of endpoint devices, including desktop computers, laptops, tablets and thin clients; strong technical knowledge of peripherals, including swipe devices, cheque scanners, e-signature devices and printers; extensive knowledge of managed desktop banking center environment
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Business, and/or a related field, and you’ve spent at least 3 years in a BSC role leading projects and designing solutions. It’s an asset if you have experience with Agile methodologies, and Application and/or Architecture Development.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

item.title: User Experience Product Owner
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll join our Capital Markets, Total Risk Management Technology group. The Senior Consultant, User Experience is a seasoned expert responsible for driving a digital-first user experience to increase client engagement and achieve business goals. The role uses deep knowledge in their field of expertise to plan and coordinate business tasks and deliverables, running digital design projects with minimal oversight. The Senior Consultant, User Experience analyzes situations and data using in-depth evaluation of intangibles, using human centered design to translate user needs and business requirements into award winning digital experiences. The role exercises considerable judgement for decision making on complex issues, providing art direction, design, and user experience thought leadership to ensure holistic client experiences in terms of usability standards. The role often operates in ambiguous situations and provides innovative, original ideas, accountable to broadly defined policy objectives.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Design - Develop user interface designs for mobile and desktop applications, artefacts, and project deliverables . Develop concept sketches, high fidelity wireframes, graphical assets, prototypes and interactive mock-ups, usability test plans and evaluations
  • Research and Present - Conduct  user research, user interface documentation. Deliver concept and design presentations.
  • Teamwork– Promote both user-centered and client-centered designs to project peers in a collaborative way.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate a minimum of 8+ years of UX research experience. As a Lead critical research efforts and conduct complex multi-phase, mixed-method studies that deepen our understanding of the user experience and drive product strategy.
    Work in a highly collaborative fashion as a strategic partner to business leads, product owners, and engineers to define both the long-term strategy and the short-term tactics for our products by grounding these decisions in user needs and insights
  • Prioritize research needs and approaches across multiple work streams to work on the right project, scale, and scope at the right time and ensure impact by delivering actionable insights
    Determine and recommend the most efficient and effective user-centered research approaches (qualitative and quantitative) to solve for business needs, meet agreed-upon objectives, and guide business areas through the appropriate UX process.
  • Lead foundational research activities that explore the problem space, frame the problems to be solved, and gather enough evidence and initial direction to define what to do next.
    Monitor UX project execution, including establishing and tracking UX project metrics and UX product scorecards.
  • Experience in UX research on SaaS solutions.
  • Experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research throughout an Agile development process.
  • Experience with using data analytics to identify UX research course of action a plus.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Comfortable with planning, prioritizing, conducting, analyzing and communicating research in a variety of contexts.
  • A dedicated advocate of a user-centered, evidence-based approach to product development, while balancing business needs.
  • Excellent verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with all stakeholders, customers, and team members
  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, Industrial Design, Business, Information Studies, Cognitive Psychology, Product Design or related fields.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC offers
